thread.title: ‘Fourth suspect a reclusive man’
thread.title_full: ‘Fourth suspect a reclusive man’ - Nation | The Star Online

author: thestar.com.my
title: ‘Fourth suspect a reclusive man’
text:
KUALA LUMPUR: The fourth suspect arrested in connection with the assassination of Kim Jong-nam looks like an uncle who keeps to himself, according to one of his neighbours.
The 47-year-old North Korean was arrested by police from his Dynasty Garden condominium in Kuchai Lama on Friday night.
A neighbour who lived on the fourth floor of Block B, where the suspect is living with his wife and daughter, said he was shocked by the sudden police presence.
Hot spot: A crowd of local and foreign reporters outside the Dynasty Garden condominium in Kuchai Lama after police raided the premises and arrested the North Korean suspect.  
The man, who did not wished to be identified, said he rushed out of his house at about 11pm when he heard loud screams from one of the premises in the block.
He said he heard women screaming but was stopped from coming out from his unit by plain clothes police personnel who told him to shut the door and stay inside.
“I first thought police was conducting a raid on illegal immigrants but later learned that they were conducting search for the murder suspect of Kim Jong-nam,” he said.
The man said the suspect and his family had been staying there for about a year.
He said he had seen the suspect’s wife and daughter, who is believed to be in her late teens, around the condominium more often than the suspect.
“I have seen them coming out of their condo during lunch hours but have not spoken to them.
“He is a very low profile man and we have never said hello to each other,” said the neighbour, adding that they shared the elevator seve­ral times.
A 36-year-old man who declined to be named said he saw police cars entering the compound on Friday night but was unsure of what was going on.
Lim Fui Leong, 66, said he went to sleep early on Friday and was informed about the arrest by his family when he woke up the next morning.
“I was surprised to see so many media representatives, especially from foreign countries,” he said when approached outside the guardhouse of the condominium by journalists.
